title: Bonacchi 2010  Brunello di Montalcino
description: A light, easy drinking but enjoyable expression of Brunello, this offers subtle aromas of blue flower, wild berry and a hint of baking spice. The medium-bodied palate shows black cherry, anise and a coffee note alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Chateau Lettau 2013 Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: Black cherry, vanilla, wet rocks, anise and damp herbs show on this take on the rare but increasingly popular grape. It's a tart and more medium-bodied expression of this often black-as-night varietal, showing boysenberry, a touch of tar and herbal spice on the palate.

title: Cherrier Frères 2014 Les Chailloux Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: This wine shows the intense fruitiness of the 2014 vintage. It's all about crisp acidity, green fruits and tight, steely texture. It's a refreshing wine, with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Ciringa 2013 Fosilni Breg Sauvignon Blanc (Štajerska)
description: Aromas of lemon meringue pie, lemon grass and caramelized pineapple open to flavors of wet river rocks, lemon zest and lime pith. Bright finish with strong minerality.

title: Colter's Creek 2013 Petit Verdot
description: Aromas of green herbs, flowers and soil lead to rich purple-fruit flavors and chalky tannins. It doesn't quite come together but provides intrigue.

title: Conde de Hervías & Mencos 2006 Mencos Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Rooty, nutty aromas of stewed fruits are almost baked out. On the palate, this rallies to show muscle and shape. Flavors of dried cherry, plum and raisin feature notes of caramel and spice. On the finish, this is mild and on cruise control. Drink now.

title: Covington 2012 Rough House Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Merlot (55%) and Cabernet Franc (41%) make up the majority of this blend, which is rounded out by Petit Verdot. Aromas of dried red fruit, herbs and woodspice lead to elegant, zingy, dried cranberry and spice flavors that linger.

title: D. Ventura 2012 Viña do Burato Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Spicy, minty aromas of dried herbs and modest red fruits are stony and dry. This is a juicy, agile Mencía with flavors of dry oak, spice, red currant and plum. A clean, clear, stony finish is light, bright and punchy.

title: Domaine A. Cailbourdin 2014 Les Cris  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: A full-bodied, ripe wine, this is going to develop well, with balanced acidity and ripe, perfumed apple and pear flavors. The final tang of citrus gives a great lift. A warm wine, it's already delicious and will be even better from 2017.

title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This is a rounded, ripe and full-bodied wine, with spice and light toastiness that give richness. Apple and green-plum flavors are enhanced by the creamy texture and touches of apricots. It is young and drinkable now, although will likely be much better from the end of 2016.

title: Château de Bel 2012 Franc de Bel Red (Vin de France)
description: It's rare in Bordeaux to find a single-varietal wine, particularly made from Cabernet Franc.This impressive, spicy wine brings out all the perfumed character of the grape. It could do with some aging, so drink from 2017.

title: Château de Santenay 2012  Mercurey
description: This wine is ripe with a texture that remains tangy while also showing rich yellow and white fruits. A rustic edge adds interest rather than detracting from the quality. With its acidity and zesty citrus character, the aftertaste leaves a fresh, crisp feeling. Drink now.

title: Château de Santenay 2013 En Vesvau  (Saint-Aubin)
description: Full in the mouth, this rich wine comes from vineyards in the hillside valley above Puligny-Montrachet. It has something of the same balance between ripe fruit and a steely texture. The acidity is there, embedded in the toast and ripe pear flavors. Drink from 2017.

title: Château de Santenay 2013  Mercurey
description: This wine is perfumed and fruity while also having a rustic edge. Tannins and acidity cut through the red plum and berry fruits. It does need to age, so drink from 2017.

title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2012 Beau Geste Red
description: Named after a term for beautiful gesture, this wine is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon with small amounts the other primary Bordeaux varieties blended in. Aromas of dark cherry, black tea, pencil lead and vanilla are followed by well-constructed smoke and dark fruit flavors with grainy, compact tannins that need some time to stretch their legs.

title: Balancing Act 2014 Chardonnay (Washington)
description: The yellow apple, melon and spice aromas are bright and inviting. The palate is fresh and clean, with broad, vibrant flavors playing nicely against a tart finish.

title: Balverne 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a crispness and upfront brightness that speaks to low oak. Lemony with a bite of green apple, it offers a backdrop of marshmallow on the finish.

title: Domaine Vrignaud 2014 Les Champréaux  (Chablis)
description: This is fresh with lemons and apples filled out by a mineral texture that gives the wine a fine bite. It's light, crisp and zesty. Drink now.

title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2013  Chablis
description: Crisp, fresh and fruity, this wine has bright citrus and currant flavors, with a tangy background. There's no sign of oak, just fresh fruit. It finishes with an attractive floral, apple-scented aftertaste.

title: Domaine Saint-Aix 2014 Authentique  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: Ripe, full bodied and still young, this generous wine is open with its fresh apples and creamy texture that give richness. A touch of toastiness adds to the complexity and potential of the wine. Drink now, although it will be better from the end of 2016.

title: Epiphany 2014 Inspiration White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Salted peach, hints of dried banana and wisps of smoke show on the rather light and restrained nose of this bottling by Eli Parker and winemaker Blair Fox. The palate plays on acid-driven minerality and the grippy textural side of the grapes, with flavors of yellow apple, ripe nectarine, sea salt and mandarin orange.

title: Fess Parker 2014 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's bountiful energy on the sizzling nose of this semisweet bottling, with aromas of baking soda, just-cut limes, lemon rinds and a touch of ripe peach. The palate offers apple syrup and peels, tartness from lemon and lime skins, and richness from flavors of orange water and jasmine.

title: Fess Parker 2014 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: Salted stonefruit, Key-lime pie and eggy brioche notes show on the nose of this entry-level Viognier from the longtime producer. The palate offers lime blossoms, white peach, slight quinine and a touch of caramel in the midpalate, presented with a grippy texture.

title: Fattoria La Lecciaia 2011  Brunello di Montalcino
description: Raspberry jam, prune, cake spice and grilled herb aromas unfold on this full-bodied wine. The palate is already rather evolved, offering dried black cherry, fig, anise and tobacco alongside mature tannins that lead to a tongue-drying finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Fortress 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 7% Syrah and smaller proportions of Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and other grapes, this well-made wine is restrained in style.It shows crisp red fruit, orange and cranberry loaded around dusty tannins, big oak and chocolate.

title: Marco Abella 2014 Òlbia White (Priorat)
description: Aromas of citrus, especially white grapefruit and lime, are spunky and sweaty like Sauvignon Blanc or Verdejo. A solid, fleshy palate is home to a mix of citric and tropical flavors, while the finish reverts back to grapefruit, with a monotone feel. This is Macabeo, Garnacha Blanca and Pedro Ximénez.

title: Matteo 2014 Chenin Blanc (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas of spice, lees and ripe pear are followed by creamy feeling tropical fruit flavors, with pineapple in the lead. It doesn't quite all come together but provides plenty of intrigue.

title: Maurice Ecard 2013 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: The texture and structure of this wine may be light but the fruitiness is so appealing. Soft and ripe with red-berry fruit flavors and refreshing acidity, it will develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Mission Hill 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)
description: Pinot Noir from Canada can often be quite delicate, but this is a full-bodied, even muscular effort. Toasty and tasty, it puts a pleasant roasted character upon ripe strawberry and cherry fruit. Tannins are substantial, along with some barrel flavors from nine months in French oak.

title: Jean-Claude Roux 2014  Quincy
description: This is a soft wine, full of ripe apple and white currant fruit flavors. It's fresh , but also has a steely edge that gives a strong texture. Produced from chalk and clay soils, it is tight, rich and needs a few months more in bottle. Drink from 2017.
